title: 'My neighbour's cat keeps managing to enter our house': Liquid feline wiggles into the neighbor's house on a regular basis, leaving neighbor in awe of feline's impurrsive parkour skills
description: Hey there, cat lovers and feline enthusiasts! Today, we are taking a journey through the whimsical world of the liquid-to-solid spectrum, with extra emphasis on the feline experience. Cats are amazingly able to defy the laws of physics and transform into puddles—or whatever shape they need to take to get from point A to point B—blurring the boundaries of feline physics with their liquid-solid spectrum antics. We've got to give it up for cats. Their flexibility is simply inspiring. We humans struggle to merely bend over to tie our shoes.One such liquid feline has mastered the art of sneaking into his neighbor's house. Well, it's not so much "sneaking" because he does it with no shame at all, in broad daylight. Because he does not give a hoot about what his neighbor thinks about these guest appearances, as far as the cat is concerned, he is the true owner of his neighbor's house. The neighbor should really be thanking Mr. Liquid Cat for allowing him to continue residing in Mr. Cat's part-time home. Read on for all the details!
author: kalila courban
excerpt: 'My neighbour's cat keeps managing to enter our house': Liquid feline wiggles into the neighbor's house on a regular basis, leaving neighbor in awe of feline's impurrsive parkour skills - World's largest collection of cat memes and other animals

html:
Hey there, cat lovers and feline enthusiasts! Today, we are taking a journey through the whimsical world of the liquid-to-solid spectrum, with extra emphasis on the feline experience. Cats are amazingly able to defy the laws of physics and transform into puddles—or whatever shape they need to take to get from point A to point B—blurring the boundaries of feline physics with their liquid-solid spectrum antics. We've got to give it up for cats. Their flexibility is simply inspiring. We humans struggle to merely bend over to tie our shoes.

One such liquid feline has mastered the art of sneaking into his neighbor's house. Well, it's not so much "sneaking" because he does it with no shame at all, in broad daylight. Because he does not give a hoot about what his neighbor thinks about these guest appearances, as far as the cat is concerned, he is the true owner of his neighbor's house. The neighbor should really be thanking Mr. Liquid Cat for allowing him to continue residing in Mr. Cat's part-time home. Read on for all the details!
